diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with a history of diverticulosis and reported one day of abdominal pain localized to the lower quadrants, associated with nausea but without fevers or chills. The CT scan findings revealed focal segment of sigmoid colonic wall thickening and fat stranding around multiple diverticula, indicative of acute diverticulitis. Additionally, there were signs of microperforation and significant fecal loading, supporting the diagnosis.
